item.title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to extend the pilot program for alternative water source projects.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7835)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7834-7835)

item.name: Federal aid to water pollution control
Federal aid to water resources development

summary.text: Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to increase the amount of authorized appropriations for the pilot program for alternative water source projects and extend program authorization through FY 2009.

bill.title: A bill to amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to extend the pilot program for alternative water source projects.

A bill to amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to extend the pilot program for alternative water source projects.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
